author: Anonymous Comp
title: edx question
question: Hi, can someone please explain this one? It's on edx 4a self-reference, I'm confused why the number is not 0, because if base case is empty, then nothing in it, so it should be 0? Thanks!
student_answer:
We want a function that multiplies all the numbers in the list. If the base case was 0, the function would return zero no matter what list was passed through it. 
A base case should be defined based on its functionality, not always just empty = 0.
